business.headline: India is flying more, but why do airlines still struggleIndia's skies are busier than ever, airports are expanding, and passengers are flying in record numbers. Yet the business of running an airline remains unforgiving.

New insurance rules: Will claim settlements improve for policyholders?The new insurance laws strengthen oversight and enforcement. In this special report, IndiaToday.in examines whether that will actually improve claim settlements for policyholders.
Silver slips after hitting record high of Rs 2.04 lakh/kg in Delhi, gold flatSpot silver was trading 0.56 per cent higher at USD 65.85 per ounce in the overseas trade.

From ports to airports: What pushed Adani Group into aviationJeet Adani, Gautam Adani's younger son and a director at Adani Airports, said the experience gained in ports and logistics helped the group enter aviation with confidence.

Why Jeet Adani says resilience is the next big challenge for Indian aviationWhile speaking to India Today, Adani said that aviation is a fragile system in which even small issues can quickly escalate into major problems.

Navi Mumbai airport will be one of most sustainable airports in world: Jeet AdaniSpeaking in the 'Jab We Met' segment, Jeet Adani said development and ecology should not be viewed as opposing ideas. He said large infrastructure projects must grow in a way that protects natural systems, as this also helps safeguard long-term assets and operations.
Built for the future: Jeet Adani on how Navi Mumbai Airport changes Mumbai aviationJeet Adani said the new airport will unlock long-term growth and improve global connectivity for the city.

Avadhut Sathe gets interim relief as SAT defreezes accounts for expensesIn August, Sebi conducted a search-and-seizure operation at Avadhut Sathe's Karjat Trading Academy as part of a broader crackdown on financial influencers offering market advice without proper registration.
Sensex ends 447 points higher, Nifty above 25,900; RIL up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex added 447.55 points to close at 84,929.36, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 150.85 points to end at 25,966.40.

Got an SMS or email from the Income Tax Department? Here's what it meansGot an unexpected SMS or email from the Income Tax Department about your transactions and unsure what to do next? The department has clarified the purpose behind these alerts.

Adani Group to bid for 11 airports amid India's air travel boom: ReportThe Indian government has been leasing out government-owned airports on long-term contracts to private companies. At the same time, it is encouraging the construction of new airports to improve connectivity across the country.

8th Pay Commission update: How big could be the salary hike and what to expectHere's what central government employees can realistically expect from the 8th Pay Commission now that the 7th CPC's term ends in December 2025 and when the cash might actually hit bank accounts.

ICICI Prudential AMC makes strong debut: What long, short-term investors should doICICI Prudential AMC share price: The listing was slightly below grey market expectations. Ahead of the debut, the IPO was commanding a grey market premium of Rs 520–530, which had indicated possible listing gains of around 24%.

ICICI Prudential AMC shares list at 20% premium: Hold or sell?Shares of ICICI Prudential AMC debuted at Rs 2,606.20 on the BSE, marking a premium of 20.38% over the IPO issue price of Rs 2,165. On the NSE, the stock opened at around Rs 2,600, up 20.09%.
Sensex jumps 500 points: 3 reasons why stock market is rising today?At around 9:45 am, the S&P BSE Sensex jumped 525.11 points to 85,006.92, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed 147.50 points to 25,963.30.

Ola Electric shares fall over 60% this year: What should investors do?The stock has now fallen nearly 63% in calendar year 2025, making it one of the worst-performing newly listed technology stocks this year. Ola Electric shares hit a fresh 52-week low of Rs 31.54 on Thursday.

Japan's central bank raises rates to 0.75%, highest in 30 yearsThe Bank of Japan raised its short-term policy rate to 0.75% from 0.5%, its first rate hike since January. In a statement, the Bank of Japan said that even after the hike, financial conditions would remain supportive for the economy

How aluminium is changing the job story in India's mineral-rich statesIndustry estimates cited by the Aluminium Association of India show that the sector has already generated over eight lakh jobs and supports 4,000 SMEs in its downstream ecosystem.
Sensex opens 300 points higher, Nifty above 25,900; Infosys up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 525.11 points to 85,006.92, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 147.50 points to 25,963.30 as of 9:45 am.

ICICI Prudential AMC IPO listing today: Is GMP pointing to gains for investors?The ICICI Prudential AMC IPO saw very strong demand during its three-day bidding period. The issue was subscribed 39.17 times overall.

entertainment.headline: Mumtaz opens up on charging Rs 20 lakh for Indian Idol appearance with Dharmendra Veteran actor Mumtaz shared that her rare television appearance on Indian Idol 13 alongside Dharmendra came with a fee of Rs 18–20 lakh, explaining why she continues to stay away from TV.

PM Narendra Modi biopic Maa Vande starts shoot, Marco actor Unni Mukundan in lead Actor Unni Mukundan has begun shooting for his new film, 'Maa Vande'. The upcoming drama is based on the life of Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

The Great Indian Kapil Show 4 ep 1 review: Same sofa, same jokes, bigger deja vu The first episode of 'The Great Indian Kapil Show' Season 4 premiered on Netflix on December 20, and for comedy lovers, it comes with a small disclaimer. While it may not always tickle your funny bone, it still works as a decent, family-friendly binge-watch.

My head bashed on window: Nora Fatehi updates fans after car accident. Watch video After Nora Fatehi sustained minor injuries in a car accident in Mumbai on Saturday afternoon, the actor shared her health update in a video on social media. She described the incident as 'one of the most terrifying and traumatic moments' of her life.

Yash's Toxic: Kiara Advani as Nadia promises layered, intense turn in first poster The makers of 'Toxic: A Fairytale for Grown-Ups' have released the first official look at Kiara Advani's character, Nadia. This highlights a significant new chapter in both Advani's acting career and the Kannada film industry.

Sohail celebrates birthday with Salman, Arbaaz and Khan-daan Sohail Khan celebrated his birthday on Saturday with a family gathering that included Salman Khan, Salim Khan, Helen, and Arbaaz Khan, bringing the Khan family together for the occasion.

Dharmendra's final wish: India and Pakistan both should see Ikkis Sunny Deol shared a behind-the-scenes video of late veteran actor Dharamendra from his final film 'Ikkis'. The video highlights Dharmendra's hopes for unity through the upcoming movie.

Dhurandhar box office Day 16: Ranveer's spy thriller nears Rs 800 crore worldwide Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' continues its strong box office performance, achieving Rs 785 crore globally in 16 days despite competition from 'Avatar: Fire and Ash'. The Aditya Dhar-directed spy thriller is on track to become India's highest-grossing film of 2025.

How Nick Jonas once made Priyanka Chopra's Karwa Chauth extra special During her recent appearance on 'The Great Indian Kapil Show 4', Priyanka Chopra recalled that she broke her Karwa Chauth fast on a plane with Nick Jonas, offering new insight into her celebrations and personal life.

Dhurandhar: Akshaye Khanna's Rehman Dakait is among Bollywood's best villains ever By letting Akshaye Khanna's Rehman Dakait take the spotlight in Dhurandhar, Aditya Dhar does something remarkable: He gives Bollywood one of its greatest villains.

Nora Fatehi suffers minor injuries after drunk driver rams her car in Mumbai Nora Fatehi was involved in a minor road accident in Mumbai but showed remarkable resilience by attending the Sunburn Festival despite a slight concussion.

Dhurandhar actor Danish Pandor reacts to Hrithik Roshan's view on film's politics Dhurandhar actor Danish Pandor has responded to Hrithik Roshan's review of the film, saying its political and terror-related elements are backed by research and undeniable facts.

They hadn't seen my films: Madhuri Dixit on sons discovering her stardom in college  Madhuri Dixit shared that her sons Arin and Ryan didn't watch most of her films while growing up, leaving their college friends shocked by the revelation.

Zeeshan Ayyub on interfaith marriage to Rasika Agashe: Love takes care of everything Zeeshan Ayyub opened up about his interfaith marriage to Rasika Agashe, saying it felt natural as he grew up with a Hindu mother and Muslim father.

Kangana Ranaut calls Aditya Dhar the real Dhurandhar after watching the film Kangana Ranaut praised Aditya Dhar's Dhurandhar, calling the filmmaker the true "Dhurandhar" of the film as it continues its strong box office run.

Hrithik Roshan's Uttarakhand trek includes visit to Santala Devi temple. Pics Hrithik Roshan was seen offering prayers at the Santala Devi temple in Dehradun during his recent trekking trip in Uttarakhand.

Keep the Tricolor flying high: Parineeti Chopra hosts champion Harmanpreet Kaur Parineeti Chopra and Raghav Chadha hosted Indian women's cricket team captain Harmanpreet Kaur at their Mumbai home, celebrating her achievements and humility.

Mohanlal breaks down while paying tribute to Sreenivasan, videos go viral Mohanlal, along with Sathyan Anthikad, paid his last respects to veteran actor-filmmaker Sreenivasan at Ernakulam Town Hall, with emotional visuals of the actor going viral.

After 43 years, Bhojpuri classic Nadiya Ke Paar to return on the big screen The 1982 Bhojpuri classic Nadiya Ke Paar is returning to the big screen after 43 years with a special screening in Patna to reconnect Bihar's youth with their cultural roots.

general news.headline: Railways hikes travel fares, AC tickets to cost Rs 10 more for every 500 kmThe revision is expected to generate around Rs 600 crore in additional revenue. Monthly season tickets and suburban train fares remain unchanged. The fare adjustment is aimed at balancing operational costs while keeping rail travel largely affordable for short-distance commuters and daily passengers.

In debate on existence of God, Javed Akhtar's 'PM Modi is better' retortThe nearly two-hour debate on 'Does God Exist?' marked a rare public exchange between Javed Akhtar, a self-proclaimed atheist, and Mufti Shamail Nadwi, an Islamic scholar with online clout.

IND vs PAK Live: India lose 5 wickets in first 10 oversIND U19 vs PAK 19 Live Updates: India have lost half their side in the first 10 overs. The top order has failed, and has left the side in a heap of trouble, Vedant Trivedi is the latest to fall as India continue to fall in the spiral.

No attempt to breach: India on protest outside Bangladesh mission in DelhiIndia dismissed what it called misleading reports about a protest outside the Bangladesh High Commission in New Delhi, saying a small group of youths briefly gathered to protest the lynching of Hindu man Dipu Chandra Das in Bangladesh and were dispersed peacefully.

Paying to get insulted: What makes people throng roast comedy showsAt a time when even a mildly worded tweet can spark outrage, a parallel universe exists inside comedy clubs: one where people pay to get roasted. Comedians are cashing in, turning sharp-tongued jabs into fame and full houses. But what's in it for the patrons?

Live: Trends show big win for Mahayuti in municipal polls, BJP largest partyMaharashtra Local Body Election Result Live Updates: Trends from the ongoing counting of votes in Maharashtra's local body elections indicate a sweeping advantage for the ruling Mahayuti alliance, with the BJP emerging as the single largest party across municipal councils and nagar panchayats. Early results show Mahayuti candidates leading decisively in a majority of urban bodies, while the Opposition Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) is trailing well behind. Key contests, high-profile family seats and unopposed wins have further underlined the BJP's dominance as counting continues. The elections were held in two phases, with 263 bodies voting on December 2 and the remaining 23 councils and several vacant posts going to polls on Saturday. Stay with indiatoday.in for all the live updates.

Sing secular song: Bengal singer alleges assault bid over 'Jago Maa' performanceSinger Lagnajita Chakraborty alleged that a man identified as Mehboob Mallik, a local Trinamool Congress leader according to the BJP, climbed onto the stage and attempted to assault her after her performance of the song 'Jago Maa'.

9 killed, many injured in mass shooting near tavern in South AfricaThe attack took place in Bekkersdal, near an informal tavern allegedly selling alcohol illegally. Police said some victims were randomly shot, and the motive remains unclear. This was the second mass shooting reported in South Africa this month.

India Today @ 50 Part 2: Bofors, Babri and the making of modern IndiaIndia Today @ 50 episode 2 covers India's the turbulent decade of 1985-1995, from Rajiv Gandhi's era to the 1991 economic reforms. The docu-series highlights scandals and social upheavals that reshaped politics and journalism in India.

Videos: Kashmir turns white as season's first snowfall ends dry runThe IMD has forecast more snow over the coming days, while Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah reviewed preparedness measures, focusing on roads, electricity, drinking water, and emergency services.

Lies must stop: Congress after PM Modi's big Assam handover to Pak chargeIn a post on X, Congress MP Manickam Tagore strongly rejected PM Modi's claims of a conspiracy to hand over Assam to Pakistan during Partition, calling it false and motivated.

India pauses visa services in Chittagong amid violence over Osman Hadi's deathIndia has suspended visa operations at its Chittagong application centre amid rising tensions in Bangladesh. The move follows violent protests triggered by the death of youth leader Sharif Osman Hadi and raises concerns over regional security.

My head bashed on window: Nora Fatehi updates fans after car accident. Watch videoAfter Nora Fatehi sustained minor injuries in a car accident in Mumbai on Saturday afternoon, the actor shared her health update in a video on social media. She described the incident as 'one of the most terrifying and traumatic moments' of her life.

Rift in MVA widens as Congress to go solo in Mumbai civic body pollsMaharashtra Congress in-charge Ramesh Chennithala said issues such as poor development and pollution would be central to the campaign, and confirmed preliminary talks with Vanchit Bahujan Aghadi chief Prakash Ambedkar.

16 Epstein files, including Trump's photo, disappear from US government websiteAt least 16 Epstein-related files vanished from a DOJ website without explanation, fueling speculation and frustration as key records stay missing and survivors still await full transparency.

India is flying more, but why do airlines still struggleIndia's skies are busier than ever, airports are expanding, and passengers are flying in record numbers. Yet the business of running an airline remains unforgiving.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Grey skies, bitter cold as Delhi's air quality hovers near severeDelhi faces a cold wave coupled with severe air pollution and dense fog. Flight cancellations and strict pollution measures highlight growing environmental challenges.

How Kashmiri Pheran became Delhi's winter uniformThough traditionally a unisex garment, the long woollen robe has found a special place in women's wardrobes in the capital. Its popularity in Delhi-NCR has seen a sudden rise, turning it into a mainstream winter staple.

Ghost schools in India: Why 5,149 government schools have zero studentsParliament data reveals 5,149 zero-enrolment government schools in India. This deep dive goes further — tracing where these 'ghost schools' are concentrated, why teachers remain posted, and how enrolment, migration and policy failures are quietly reshaping India's education map.

Dhurandhar box office Day 16: Ranveer's spy thriller nears Rs 800 crore worldwideRanveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' continues its strong box office performance, achieving Rs 785 crore globally in 16 days despite competition from 'Avatar: Fire and Ash'. The Aditya Dhar-directed spy thriller is on track to become India's highest-grossing film of 2025.

Google, Apple warn employees on H-1B visa not to leave USGoogle and Apple have issued warnings to H-1B visa holders against international travel due to prolonged embassy delays. The extended visa processing times threaten work continuity and could cause significant disruptions for foreign professionals.

Sridhar Vembu says Zoho is working on some important features for Arattai appZoho founder Sridhar Vembu reveals ongoing weekly updates for Arattai chat app. The company is planning a marketing push once the feature set is perfected, signalling a patient long-term strategy.

sports.headline: Conway, Latham's twin tons put New Zealand in control, West Indies face big chase New Zealand's openers made history with twin tons in both innings, setting West Indies 462 on a placid Bay Oval pitch. With all results still possible, the visitors face a stern test of skill and resolve on Day 5.

Big Hug: Smriti Mandhana's response for young Kashmiri fangirl wins hearts Indian women's batter Smriti Mandhana won hearts with a touching reply to a young fan in Kashmir as she gears up to chase a historic 4,000-run milestone in Women's T20Is during the five-match series against Sri Lanka.

Who is Sameer Minhas? Pakistan batter hits 113-ball 172 in U19 Asia Cup final U19 Asia Cup final, IND vs PAK: Sameer Minhas was at his stupendous best in the grand finale after he scored 172 off 113 balls with 17 fours and nine sixes against India at the ICC Academy Ground in Dubai on Sunday.

Bazball has failed, McCullum must go: Boycott slams England after Ashes letdown Geoffrey Boycott has launched a blistering attack on Bazball after England's latest Ashes collapse. With Australia retaining the urn, Boycott insists England must change leadership and mindset to avoid repeating familiar failures.

Can't be so poor: Disappointed Ben Stokes slams England after conceding Ashes Ashes 2025, AUS vs ENG: Skipper Ben Stokes admitted England's poor execution cost them the Ashes after an 82-run loss at the Adelaide Oval left them 0–3 down, with Australia consistently outplaying them in all departments.

Repeating history? India turn to proven ODI World Cup formula for T20I success IND-W vs SL-W: India have taken an experimental approach in their preparations for the T20 World Cup, calling up Vaishnavi Sharma and G Kamalini for the T20I series against Sri Lanka. Both Kamalini and Vaishnavi helped India lift the U19 Women's T20 World Cup earlier this year.

Sanju Samson's road to T20 World Cup 2026: A Malayalam entertainer in the making Sanju Samson's journey to India's T20 World Cup 2026 squad reads like a Mohanlal-led Mollywood classic — full of promise, setbacks, and quiet resilience before a hometown send-off in Trivandrum.

Messi came and left, but Indian football stays stuck in one place For a few days, Indian football felt alive again. Once Lionel Messi left, the silence returned, exposing a stalled ISL, anxious players and a system struggling to survive without the glare of spectacle.

After ODI heroics, Ruturaj Gaikwad back as Maharashtra captain for Vijay Hazare Fresh off his maiden ODI century, Ruturaj Gaikwad returns to domestic duty as Maharashtra captain. The Vijay Hazare Trophy offers him a chance to extend his form and lead a strong, balanced squad.

IND vs PAK Live: India lose 5 wickets in first 10 overs IND U19 vs PAK 19 Live Updates: India have lost half their side in the first 10 overs. The top order has failed, and has left the side in a heap of trouble, Vedant Trivedi is the latest to fall as India continue to fall in the spiral.

England implode once again in Adelaide, lose Ashes after just 11 days of cricket Ashes: England lost the Ashes 2025-26 after hosts Australia took a 3-0 lead on Sunday, December 21. Ben Stokes' team were blown away once again and lost the Adelaide Test by 82 runs.

After ODI glory, India Women pivot to T20 World Cup preps with Sri Lanka seriesIND-W vs SL-W, 1st T20I: India will begin their preparations for the T20 World Cup with a five-match T20I series against Sri Lanka. The spotlight will be on Harmanpreet Kaur, Smriti Mandhana and other senior players who played pivotal roles in the ODI World Cup triumph.

Want to rip my hair out: England fans cannot tolerate Bazball any moreAshes: Jamie Smith's dismissal on the final day of the 3rd Test match had England fans fuming. Batting on 60, Smith lost his wicket trying to hit his third consecutive boundary, leaving England reeling in the Test match.

Shubman Gill told of T20 World Cup snub on the day of squad announcement: ReportsShubman Gill's T20 World Cup omission came as a surprise not just to fans but to the batter himself. Reports suggest he was informed only moments before the BCCI made the squad announcement public.

Ashes 2025 3rd Test: Australia suffer big scare as Nathan Lyon limps off injuredAustralia's Ashes momentum was shaken after Nathan Lyon limped off injured on Day 5 in Adelaide. The veteran spinner's hamstring scare has put his series availability under doubt at a critical stage.

Often criticised, Ajit Agarkar, BCCI get 10 on 10 for T20 World Cup 2026 squadOften criticised for his selection calls, Ajit Agarkar got things spot on with his bold calls for the T20 World Cup 2026. The snubbing of Shubman Gill, making course corrections, and the recall of Ishan Kishan into the side have seen Agarkar and the BCCI being brave enough to accept their mistakes and select a 10 on 10 team for the upcoming ICC event.

Kylian Mbappe equals Cristiano Ronaldo's Real Madrid, reveals relationship with idolKylian Mbappe matched Cristiano Ronaldo's iconic Real Madrid calendar-year goal record with a birthday strike. The French star revealed Ronaldo's guidance eased his transition and inspired a symbolic Siu celebration at the Santiago Bernabéu stadium.

Pakistan hockey in turmoil as players await due payment from authorities: ReportUnpaid dues and financial instability continue to affect Pakistan's hockey players, with pending payments for camps, tours, and international participation from the national federation. National captain Ammad Shakeel Butt and other players highlight the impact on their careers and advocate for structural changes.

Ishan Kishan's respect for domestic cricket paved his World Cup comeback, says AshwinR Ashwin says Ishan Kishan's T20 World Cup return is a result of his domestic grind, from Buchi Babu to SMAT, calling it a full-circle moment earned through discipline and respect for the game.

Watch: India coach Gambhir refuses to answer query on Gill's T20 World Cup snubIndia coach Gautam Gambhir refused to answer questions about Shubman Gill's snub from the T20 World Cup 2026 after the squad was announced on Saturday, December 20. Gill was the surprise omission from the side as India will look to defend their title at home.

T20 World Cup: How Kishan's call-up signals BCCI's change in selection mantraSunil Gavaskar claims that Ishan Kishan's selection for the T20 World Cup 2026 shows that BCCI do value domestic cricket and is considering it as a part of the criteria for having players picked into the India squad.

With T20 World Cup as goal, right time to give youngsters chances: Harmanpreet KaurIND-W vs SL-W, 1st T20I: Harmanpreet Kaur said India will use the Sri Lanka T20I series to give youngsters opportunities and prepare with a fearless mindset for the T20 World Cup.

Shubman Gill's T20 World Cup 2026 axe decided before Ahmedabad T20I: ReportT20 World Cup 2026: Shubman Gill's sudden omission for the 2026 T20 World Cup has sparked debate, with form, fitness concerns and a late course correction leaving the opener out as Samson and Kishan step into the spotlight.

Satwik-Chirag's magical run in BWF World Tour finals end with semi-final lossSatwik-Chirag's incredible run at the BWF World Tour Finals came to an end in the semi-finals as they lost to China's Liang Wei Keng and Wang Chang in three games. The Indian pair end their 2025 without a title to their name.

New era for Zimbabwe cricket: Richard Ngarava named ODI and Test team captainZimbabwe Cricket has announced key leadership changes, appointing Richard Ngarava as the new Test and ODI captain, with Brian Bennett stepping in as vice-captain. The board expressed confidence in the new leadership and paid tribute to outgoing captain Craig Ervine.

History beckons: Mandhana, Deepti eye huge records in Sri Lanka T20I seriesIND-W vs SL-W: Smriti Mandhana is looking to become the first Indian batter with 4000 Women's T20I runs while Deepti Sharma has a chance to become the all-time leading wicket-taker in the format.

Adipoli Chetta: Sanju Samson's inclusion in T20 World Cup squad leaves Ashwin pleasedR Ashwin's enthusiastic reaction to Sanju Samson's T20 World Cup return lit up social media, as the veteran spinner praised his 'thambi' and backed India's chances of defending their title in 2026.

Suryakumar Yadav will be back: India captain vows to regain form before T20 World CupIND vs SA: Indian captain Suryakumar Yadav struggled in T20Is in 2025, scoring just 218 runs in 19 innings at an average of 13.62, without a single half-century to his name.

England won't give up: Zak Crawley issues war cry despite Ashes hopes fadingDespite facing an almost certain series defeat, England's Zak Crawley insists the team will continue to fight and look for a win in the Adelaide Test. Australia are just four wickets away from claiming an Ashes series win.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
